events.name: Baltimore Startup Weekend ver 2.0
events.about:
For all event details related to the Baltimore Startup Weekend, including sponsorship, please visit http://baltimore.startupweekend.org or follow us at @baltsw.

Thanks!

Baltimore Startup Weekend Team

 

 

Refund Policy:  No refunds will be granted within 7 days of the event if food and drink have already been ordered. Apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

About Startup Weekend: Startup Weekends are 54-hour events designed to provide superior experiential education for technical and non-technical entrepreneurs.  Beginning with Friday night pitches and continuing through brainstorming, business plan development, and basic prototype creation, Startup Weekends culminate in Sunday night demos and presentations.  Participants create working startups during the event and are able to collaborate with like-minded individuals outside of their daily networks. All teams hear talks by industry leaders and receive valuable feedback from local entrepreneurials. The weekend is centered around action, innovation, and education.  Whether you are looking for feedback on a idea, a co-founder, specific skill sets, or a team to help you execute, Startup Weekends are the perfect environment in which to test your idea and take the first steps towards launching your own startup.

events.name: Groundwork
events.about:
You’ve heard of hack-a-thons -- marathon coding sessions with a goal of producing some type of algorithm or web or mobile application in the span of 48 hours? gb.tc is doing you one better with their two upcoming events happening in Baltimore, Maryland.

The goal of the two events is to change the way developers, policy makers and concerned citizens are coming together to tackle local problems through the use of open government data, local assets, community mobilization and good ideas.

The formula has changed on how to solve local problems. First gb.tc has broken a traditional hackathon into two separate events, Baltimore UnWIREd, held August 24 – 25, 2012 and Groundwork, happening September 28 – 29, 2012. Baltimore UnWired focuses on the identification of assets and problems and the formation of teams and Groundwork is the event where teams reconvene to execute their strategies. Come be part of this new formula of change and solve problems at a local level.

This is an opportunity to work together directly with the federal Department of Health and Human Services, and the Mayors and Governors offices to help affect critical change in Baltimore.

Come help us make a real difference. (Plus, therell be food and prizes!)

Made possible with support from:

MLN Advertising

events.name: Art Bytes at the Walters
events.about:
Art has the power to bring people from diverse backgrounds together for enjoyment, discovery and learning. In this spirit, Baltimore will hold Art Bytes, a hackathon where technology and creative communities work together to build programs and applications inspired by art or to address specific challenges faced by museums. This will be Baltimore’s, and perhaps the nation’s, first art museum hackathon. 

This event will be at the Walters Art Museum from July 27–July 29. On Friday evening, July 27, staff from Baltimore’s museum community will present specific challenges or ideas that they would like solved—from how to use technology to experience a collection to how to virtually access archives. Over the course of the weekend, technologists, innovators, scholars and artists will coalesce into teams in the Walters’ Sculpture Court to design and develop their solution. Participants will be able to visit the museum’s galleries for inspiration throughout the weekend. On Sunday afternoon, July 29, leaders of the technology and innovation communities will judge which teams were the most successful. The experience of Art Bytes will be captured on video, and the team solutions displayed at Walters the following week.

 

Where: The Walters Art Museum, Sculpture Court

When: Friday, July 27–Sunday, July 29

     Friday, July 27, 5–9 p.m.

     Saturday, July 28, 10 a.m.–midnight

     Sunday, July 29, 10 a.m.–5 p.m.

Price: Free

events.name: Baltimore Hackathon 2012
events.about:
Come out and hack away on any hardware or software project and show it off for a chance to win prizes.  A ticket includes a t-shirt and food for the weekend!

See the baltimorehackathon.com website for more details and a link to the previous hackathons prizes and winners.

events.name: Advanced Application Development Day
events.about:
Build Bigger and Better Applications

Are you an experienced or advanced developer with over 5 years of developing applications for consumers or businesses, desktop or mobile?

Join us for a day long seminar, presentations, and a hack-a-thon to test your skills.  Learn something new and connect with other advanced developers.  Interested in the science and technology behind personalization?  Do you know what the latest disruptive technology is in the area of application service delivery? 

This seminar will offer AI based personalization development education and provide an introduction to Semantic Labs CubeX development platform - which can provide innovative capabilities and save you or your client hundreds of thousands of dollars in development expenses in building next generation applications.

We want to help you build connections with other developers in the area and collaborate for large scale projects.  Team up for a coding contest using information youve learned throughout the day.

This seminar is invite only

events.name: CreateBaltimore Hackathon, Follow-Up, and Future Plans
events.about:
In the closing session at CreateBaltimore, lots of participants reported on their sessions and outlined possible next steps. Many people are already at work on their spin-off and follow-up activities, but how can we keep the momentum going? How can we ensure that something comes of these connections and conversations? The answers to these questions is really up to you.

In the meantime, we propose the following:

(1) CreateBaltimore Action Session and Hackathon

When: Sunday, March 4, 2012 1-5pm
Where: Single Carrot Theatre & Baltimore Node

Who: Any and all participants in CreateBaltimore (2011 or 2012) and any other interested people

What: Join us in brainstorming and planning CreateBaltimore 3, tentatively scheduled for June 2012 and/or participate in a hackathon to create online tools to capture and sustain our shared efforts.

(2) CreateBaltimore Follow-up Sessions.

In the early evening of March 4, starting at 5:30pm, we invite you to schedule a follow-up session to discussions started at CreateBaltimore. We have made arrangements with a number of Station North establishments (Joe Squared, Liams, Windup Space, Cyclops, Bohemian, etc).  Contact as at info@createbaltimore.org to match your meeting to one of those venues. Send us your idea for a follow up session and the location youd like to meet in, and well make sure the word gets out.

(3) Whether or not you can join us on March 4, help sustain the dialogue by participating online in several ways:

  • CreateBaltimore email discussion group
  • CreateBaltimore2 Lanyrd Page
  • CreateBaltimore Facebook Group
  • We are collecting other ways of staying connected on our website: http://createbaltimore.org/pages/connect

(4) Help us learn from and improve the CreateBaltimore project by taking this (very) brief survey: https://www.surveymonkey.com/s/CB2Survey                 

Thank you for all youve done (and will do) to build creative community in Baltimore!

Sincerely,

Scott Burkholder
Andrew Hazlett
Buck Jabaily
Dave Troy
events.address: Load of Fun Building 122 W North Avenue
